subject: Re: A bit confusing.
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
FS:

Well, if the waves have to bend around corners and work their way 
through chambers, that is an echo box in my opinion, as the sound waves 
are delayed and thus slowed down by doing so.  I think you are fine to 
call it an echo box, as slowing down the sound may be why it helps the 
sound of the voices become more discernable.  Bruce slows his 
recordings down a bit to make them easier to hear, as well.  One way is 
by a box of chambers, the other by way of a computer program.

Sounds good to me, Frank.

LC
http://www.AngelsGhosts.com
